item.title: 'British humour made me smile' - Tuchel enjoys fans' chants
item.description: Thomas Tuchel says England fans' chants "made him smile" as they respond to his previous criticism in full voice in Riga.

item.title: The players with points to prove as England reach World Cup
item.description: England have qualified for next summer's World Cup, but who are the players who must still prove they deserve a spot in Thomas Tuchel's squad?

item.title: All you need to know about 2026 World Cup
item.description: England have secured their place at the 2026 World Cup and this is all you need to know about next summer's tournament.

item.title: Armenia captain 'lost his head' - Republic of Ireland's Azaz on red card
item.description: Republic of Ireland's Finn Azaz says Armenian captain Tigran Barseghyan "lost his head" when he was sent off for headbutting the Irish midfielder.

item.title: Who makes your England World Cup starting XI?
item.description: Who would you pick in your England XI for the 2026 World Cup?

item.title: Ivory Coast and Senegal claim places at World Cup
item.description: Ivory Coast and Senegal become the final two African sides to secure automatic qualification for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Did Man City let De Bruyne leave too soon?
item.description: Kevin de Bruyne is in sparkling form for Napoli and Belgium this season - did he leave Man City too soon?

item.title: Muscat leads race to become new Rangers head coach
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the leading candidate to replace Russell Martin as Rangers head coach, although the Ibrox club are talking to other targets.

item.title: Highlights: De Bruyne stars as Belgium dent Wales' World Cup hopes
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Wales lose 4-2 to Belgium in World Cup qualifying in Cardiff.

item.title: Woltemade scores as Germany beat Northern Ireland
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Newcastle United striker Nick Woltemade scores the only goal as Germany beat Northern Ireland in World Cup qualifying.

item.title: Shaky Scotland hold on for nervy win over Belarus
item.description: Watch the best of the action as goals from Che Adams and Scott McTominay earn Scotland a narrow World Cup qualifying win over Belarus.

item.title: Man City come from behind to beat Liverpool
item.description: Iman Beney and Aoba Fujino score for Manchester City as they come from 1-0 down at triumph at Anfield to extend Liverpool's winless start to the WSL season.

item.title: Clarke 'really, really disappointed' by Scotland despite win
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke is pleased with victory but unhappy with his side's performance in their World Cup qualification win over Belarus.

item.title: 'In the form of his life' - How England players rated
item.description: BBC Sport assesses how England performed against Latvia during the Three Lions' 5-0 victory.

item.title: Which teams have qualified for the World Cup and who is on the brink?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: Wiegman wanted retired Bright in England squad
item.description: Sarina Wiegman says she wanted Millie Bright in England's squad for this month's friendlies before the defender retired from international football.

item.title: Inter Milan want Palace's Guehi - Wednesday's gossip
item.description: Crystal Palace defender Marc Guehi is now a target for Inter Milan, Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo has a secret release clause, Chelsea want Portuguese teenager Cardoso Varela, plus more.

item.title: Ex-Premier League referee Coote admits child image offence
item.description: David Coote was charged on 12 August following an investigation by Nottinghamshire Police.

item.title: 'I love the country' - Potter open to Sweden job
item.description: Former Chelsea and West Ham manager Graham Potter is interested in becoming Sweden's next head coach.

item.title: Quiz: English managers to take charge of national teams
item.description: BBC Sport has put together a list of 10 English managers to take charge of international teams - can you name them?

item.title: Ward urges Wales to use Euros as World Cup fuel
item.description: Wales must use their historic appearance at Euro 2025 as a springboard to qualify for a first World Cup, says former striker Helen Ward.

item.title: 'He made players look like Sunday League footballers' - Sweden sack Tomasson
item.description: Sweden sack manager Jon Dahl Tomasson following a poor start to their 2026 World Cup qualifying campaign.

item.title: Northern Ireland relish play-off task after Germany loss
item.description: Northern Ireland players are already relishing trying to secure a play-off World Cup berth despite their defeat against Germany.

item.title: Will brave Wilshere choice pay off for Luton?
item.description: Jack Wilshere takes charge of Luton Town after just two games as a head coach, but how good a fit will the former England midfielder be?

item.title: Barcelona's Lewandowski could miss El Clasico
item.description: Striker Robert Lewandowski has a hamstring injury and could miss Barcelona's game against Real Madrid later this month.

item.title: 'Biggest thing since independence' - Cape Verde celebrates World Cup spot
item.description: Cape Verdeans took to the streets to celebrate qualifying for the World Cup, with many hailing it the best day since gaining independence in 1975.

item.title: Quiz: Which nations have qualified for 2026 World Cup?
item.description: For this week's big Tuesday quiz we want you to name every nation who has already qualified for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: England's striking dilemma - how would you rank Tuchel's options?
item.description: Marcus Rashford? Ollie Watkins? Ivan Toney? Who's the best England striker after Harry Kane?

item.title: Liverpool midfielder Hobinger suffers ACL injury
item.description: Liverpool confirm Austria midfielder Marie Hobinger suffered an anterior cruciate ligament injury against Manchester City last weekend.

item.title: 'Freak of nature' rat invades Wales' qualifier
item.description: Cardiff City have defended their pest control policy after a rat made an appearance on the pitch during the second half of Wales' World Cup qualifier against Belgium.

item.title: 'Another celebrity boss? No, I've earned my chance'
item.description: Forest Green boss Robbie Savage insists he is no "celebrity manager" after guiding his new side to a dream start, including a spot in the FA Cup first round.

item.title: World Cup-bound Cape Verdean Lopes relishing his week to remember
item.description: Shamrock Rovers defender Roberto Lopes is relishing the week of his life - helping Cape Verde qualify for the World Cup, aiming for League of Ireland success with Shamrock Rovers, and expecting his first child with his wife.

item.title: Glasgow City chase Europa Cup place - watch on BBC
item.description: To reach the knockout phase of the Europa Cup SWPL leaders Glasgow City must overcome a 2-1 deficit at home to HB Koge on Wednesday.

item.title: Pickford poised to sign new Everton deal
item.description: England goalkeeper Jordan Pickford agrees a new contract to stay at Everton.

item.title: Savage's Forest Green to visit Wilshere's Luton in FA Cup
item.description: Robbie Savage's Forest Green Rovers will visit Jack Wilshere's Luton Town in the FA Cup first round.

item.title: NI down but not out after 'sore' Germany defeat
item.description: Northern Ireland's young squad were down but not out, as Michael O'Neill describes the 1-0 World Cup qualifying defeat by Germany as "sore".

item.title: 'Delusion to dream of win over Denmark' - fan views on Scotland
item.description: A World Cup play-off is assured and automatic qualification is possible, but how did fans view Scotland's laboured win over Belarus?

item.title: Man Utd score four against Everton to maintain unbeaten start
item.description: Substitute Jess Park scored a late double to help Manchester United secure a 4-1 win over Everton, carrying on their unbeaten start.

item.title: 'Unbelievable strike' - Walsh wins it for Chelsea against Spurs
item.description: Keira Walsh's "unbelievable strike" breaks the deadlock in the second half for Chelsea against Tottenham.

item.title: Bellamy urges Wales to embrace Belgium challenge
item.description: Wales manager Craig Bellamy urges his players to "embrace" the game against Belgium as they target automatic qualification for next year’s World Cup.

item.title: Arsenal earn first win in five games against Brighton
item.description: Arsenal end their four-match-long losing streak as they beat Brighton 1-0 in the Women's Super League at Emirates Stadium.

item.title: Arsenal lacked quality and composure - Williams
item.description: BBC Sport pundits Fara Williams and Anita Asante analyse Arsenal's attacking quality during their 1-0 Women's Super League win over Brighton.

item.title: Kirby reflects on first England call-up and 'Mini Messi' nickname
item.description: Former England star Fran Kirby reflects on the moment she received her first England call-up while playing for Reading in WSL2, which led to her breakthrough and being nicknamed 'Mini Messi'.

item.title: Stunning Walsh strike extends Chelsea's unbeaten league run
item.description: Keira Walsh delivers an incredible strike to break Chelsea's deadlock against Tottenham to win 1-0 and maintain their unbeaten WSL run.

item.title: How McTominay became a 'brother of Naples'
item.description: Scotland midfielder Scott McTominay reflects on his brilliant first season at Napoli, where he wants to keep giving his "absolute best".

item.title: Northern Ireland outclass Slovakia in Belfast
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Northern Ireland beat Slovakia 2-0 in their World Cup qualifier at Windsor Park in Belfast.

item.title: 'My family no longer attend matches because of abuse by fans'
item.description: Premier League referee Anthony Taylor says his family "no longer attend matches" after the abuse they faced from Roma fans after the 2023 Europa League final.

item.title: Scotland strike late to beat Greece in frantic finish
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Scotland score twice late on to beat Greece and boost their hopes of qualifying for next summer's World Cup finals.

item.title: Overseas game a 'sacrifice' for 'survival' of Serie A - Como
item.description: Italian club Como say "sacrifice is essential" to ensure the "survival" of Serie A amid the financial dominance of the Premier League as they press ahead with plans to play AC Milan in Perth, Australia.

item.title: 'Heart-in-mouth' Belgium loss leaves Wales facing play-off challenge
item.description: Head coach Craig Bellamy is proud of Wales' efforts to try to find a vital win despite falling short in the 4-2 World Cup qualifying defeat by Belgium.

item.title: Three players, 57 goals - who is the best striker?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the goalscoring exploits of Harry Kane, Kylian Mbappe and Erling Haaland, who are all averaging more than a goal a game.

item.title: Stadium concrete wall demolished after Vigar death
item.description: BBC Sport understands a concrete wall at Wingate & Finchley FC's stadium has been demolished following the death of Chichester City striker Billy Vigar.

item.title: Football regulator plans new licensing regime
item.description: All 116 clubs in England's top five divisions will have to prove they are financially healthy before being granted a licence allowing them to compete, under plans released by football's new watchdog.

item.title: 'Always give your max' - the drive behind Walsall's 'Uncle' Albert
item.description: Walsall's 37-year-old striker Albert Adomah lets former Saddlers midfielder and BBC Radio WM pundit Darren Wrack follow him around for the day.

item.title: How can Scotland qualify for 2026 World Cup?
item.description: Scotland will finish either first or second in their World Cup qualification group. But how do they reach the finals?

item.title: How have the big-name striker signings done so far in the Premier League?
item.description: Strikers dominated the summer transfer window and we have taken a look at how nine of them have done since their moves.

item.title: 'I thought it was a heart attack' - how collapse changed Kirby's life
item.description: Former Lioness Fran Kirby reflects on the health scare that sidelined her for 10 months and her journey back to the top of the game.

item.title: 'One of our best ever' - why Pickford is England's undisputed number one
item.description: BBC Sport looks in depth at the game of England goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, with the help of former Three Lions shot-stoppers Paul Robinson and Rob Green, and his former Toffees team-mates Wayne Rooney and Theo Walcott.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: 'Being gay in men's football is a very toxic place'
item.description: Australian Josh Cavallo, who moved to England in July to join non-league Peterborough Sports, says football has got "mountains to do" to tackle homophobia.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is '007' in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at what the tagline of '007' means and where the taunt came from.

item.title: Why did Man Utd's Yoro kick off a match in France?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Manchester United's Leny Yoro kicked off a match in France.

item.title: What are penalty retake rules after Roma penalty drama?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains the rules on penalty retakes after Roma took the same penalty three times against Lille in the Europa League

item.title: Why are Kazakhstan part of Uefa?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Kazakhstan are part of Uefa.

item.title: Why are some football shin pads so small?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore why some football shin pads are so small, and what the laws are around wearing them.

item.title: Why was Calafiori banned from using a towel for throw-ins?
item.description: Arsenal's Riccardo Calafiori was stopped from drying the ball with a towel against Newcastle - but why did that happen?

item.title: Is the Premier League getting younger?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything looks into why increasing number of teenagers and young players are playing in the Premier League this season.

item.title: Suspended sanction for Rangers' pyro rule breach
item.description: The SPFL issue a suspended reduction of 50 tickets on Rangers for future away matches after the Ibrox club are found to have breached rules on the opening day of the Premiership season.

item.title: Rangers compile new shortlist as trio ruled out
item.description: Rangers compile a new shortlist containing more than two candidates after Steven Gerrard rules himself out of the running for the vacant head coach's role.

item.title: Is Rohl answer for Rangers? Or 'rinse and repeat'?
item.description: Danny Rohl appears to be the frontrunner for the Rangers job. We examine whether he would be a good fit - or just more of the same.

item.title: The younger Mbappe emerging from his brother's shadow
item.description: Being the brother of a football superstar is not easy. But Ethan Mbappe is aiming to emerge from the shadows and make a name for himself.

item.title: The footballer who cycles to work after being inspired by Wenger
item.description: Former Arsenal defender Hector Bellerin talks about his attempts to live a more sustainable life as he wins the BBC Green Sports Award.

item.title: How Harry Kane-inspired tactic is undoing Barcelona
item.description: Barcelona have lost their latest two games and there is a Harry Kane-inspired tactical tweak that teams are using to disrupt their defence this season.

item.title: How Bright left her mark on historic Lionesses
item.description: Millie Bright's international retirement is a reflection of a changing of the guard in Sarina Wiegman's team - but her impact on England's success is unquestionable.

item.title: England defender Bright retires from internationals
item.description: England defender Millie Bright announces her retirement from international football, saying "it's a feeling and I'm at peace with it".

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
